intro: Urera chlorocarpa, commonly known as the green-leafed urera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a smooth, waxy texture, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
